weather_report:
In the heart of San Francisco, a gentle shift from morning coolness to the promise of rain paints a narrative of the day ahead. Currently, the city wraps itself in a soft blanket of mostly sunny moments, although the clouds gather on the horizon, hinting at the weather's impending turn. Warm winds seemingly wrapped around the buildings add a subtle whisper of movement, but the chill begins to take hold. As daylight deepens, expect skies to darken, and by afternoon’s end, a 60% chance of rain will usher in a coolness that is unmistakably more reminiscent of winter.

As dusk approaches, the certainty of rain transforms the atmosphere into one of cozy introspection. The marine layer lingers like a shy child, hanging just above the city, while visibility plays coy with the outlines of familiar landmarks fading in the distance. To navigate the day comfortably, layers are recommended; a sturdy jacket and warm scarf will offer solace as winds pick up, swirling from the southwest. It’s a perfect time for an afternoon stroll along Market Street, perhaps indulging in a warming cup of coffee while appreciating the reflective dance of raindrops on windows later when the predicted rain arrives. With the weather shifting, those willing to brave the elements might even find a solitary moment of serenity amidst the bustling city—just be sure to carry an umbrella, for the night promises to drench the streets in a cool embrace.
